justification: Participants rated their anger levels using a continuous scale ranging from 1 (not angry at all) to 10 (very angry). This self-rating scale was used to measure anger experienced in situations with different environmental affordances.

Similar to the anger ratings, participants rated their fear levels on a continuous scale from 1 (not fearful at all) to 10 (very fearful). These self-reports were used to measure fear experienced under different environmental conditions.
The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory was used to measure participants' trait anxiety. Trait anxiety scores were collected as control variables in the analysis.
The Behavioral Anger Response Questionnaire was employed to assess participants' trait anger. Trait anger scores served as additional control variables in the study.
